Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery cup-skyphos with lower part of rim, offset on inside and outside; interior: glazed with cluster of added white dots (berries) on rim; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of head and shoulders of youth to left, wearing white wreath and himation covering left shoulder and arm; at right, part of enclosed palmette.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (E134.6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0729) (Phase 1)
